intro: Parsonsia kunstleri, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly honeyeaters.
